title: Ticket #781: Shadow dies with SIGILL
description:
Sometimes in large batches or all the time, the condor shadow blows up with an illegal instruction. And the schedd records this fact like this: 

8/15 04:37:51 (pid:25772) Shadow pid 5142 died with signal 4 (Illegal instruction)

It could be the compiler is generating instructions that don't work across all 64-bit intel processors (both AMD64 and EM64T), but that is a guess.

See ticket for more information.
remarks:
2009-Oct-09 16:03:07 by psilord:
Ligo has stated this ticket is not urgent.

It had only happened in a single block of time on a submit machine that before and after the event ran just fine. The machine uses ECC memory which hadn't caught a bit correction in the last two weeks. So bad stick of ram is unlikely.

What is more likely is a particular user or set of jobs caused the shadow to take a weird code path leading to the SIGILL. The logs are available in the associated rust ticket and they need datamining to figure out the common condition of the faulting shadows. For example, were they all from the same user or cluster?
